item.title: 35 – I am from
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: I am from last-minute tasks and not enough time from chain-greased hands and sometimes beard from TriMet on my left side and frogs in the bottomland from high rise mid-town and southern rental I am eastside from snow flurries at … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
I am from

last-minute tasks
and not enough time
from chain-greased hands
and sometimes beard

from TriMet on my left side
and frogs in the bottomland
from high rise mid-town
and southern rental
I am eastside

from snow flurries at last
and unwashed mushroom snacks
from the ever-outward boundary
from salted prayers and Screwtape
popcorn with cumin, double-sided tape
from backpack rap

I am from spent grain
and rice flour
single pair of jeans
from fear of failure
and love of trying

from horse-people and Baptists
frat boys and team players and loners
all in the same room
I am from swearing in secret
to out-loud, loudly

I am from no dryer sheet
from guinea pigs under the stairs
from a long line of Scots-Irish
from Native stock
I am from mixed perspective
filtered down

I am from the far corner
the last, best place
from RCTID
from a torn-out hole
in my magazine heart filled
with cobbled-together tidings
and poems

I am from stable
I am from the risky dive
I am from each of these places
and none

//ht: Dan, for getting me to write one of these//

item.title: 34 – The news of you
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: “The news of you” The news of you waits blinking in the ether a glittering fish turned up unexpected wrapped in the news of the day I log on troll the bottom of how you ended screen you again rerun … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
“The news of you”

The news of you
waits blinking in the ether
a glittering fish
turned up unexpected
wrapped in the news of the day

I log on
troll the bottom
of how you ended
screen you again
rerun your best lines

In the world
where I live
where your soft body is
going quickly rigid
it is a small comfort
to know some version of you
won’t decay

//RIP PSH//

item.title: 33 – Sportsing
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Sportsing I am thrilled by sudden violence, evasive maneuvers and the threat of a win. I am strongly encouraged to eat pistachios and Coca-Cola, preferably in Detroit. My grandma is a funny-ass lady after three scotch and waters. Bruno Mars … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Sportsing

I am thrilled by sudden violence,
evasive maneuvers and the threat of a win.
I am strongly encouraged to eat pistachios
and Coca-Cola, preferably in Detroit.
My grandma is a funny-ass lady
after three scotch and waters.
Bruno Mars is a neo-Michael Jackson
with moves to match. Anthony Kedis
cannot pull off a partial ‘stache.
Philip Seymour Hoffman died
and Bob Dylan, the Muppets
and Bruce Willis want me to buy a car.
Bread and circuses require shiny trophies
filled with Bud Light. Pete Carrol had a good day.
Peyton Manning is wearing his sad-pants.
Corn chips and guac are the best
way to ruin an evening. On the couch
with my best friend watching a game
we don’t care once a year isn’t so bad.
Heartburn lingers.

item.title: 32 – Nude Descending…
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: The Delicately Rendered Nude Descending A Staircase I Once Found Among A Pile of Half-Empty Boxes And Old Furniture In An Alley That Someone Had Scrawled BITCH Across In Eyeliner And Put Their Foot Through Where Her Smile Should Have … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
The Delicately Rendered Nude Descending A Staircase I Once Found Among A Pile of Half-Empty Boxes And Old Furniture In An Alley That Someone Had Scrawled BITCH Across In Eyeliner And Put Their Foot Through Where Her Smile Should Have Been

I loved her for the blink of an eye.

//…//

item.title: 31 – Mo
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Mo Little blonde boy dressed in a blonde blazer and a bad mood. He’d crush a bug if he had one right now. What’s he carrying off to first grade? I smile at his forced scowl. It’s going to be … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Mo

Little blonde boy

dressed in a blonde blazer

and a bad mood.

He’d crush a bug

if he had one right now.

What’s he carrying

off to first grade?

I smile at his forced scowl.

It’s going to be a good day.

item.title: 30 – stone
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: stone no matter how life-like the stone feels how warm how heavy with blood how much like a wolf-cub a man-cub no matter its shape how it writhes against you how you hold it no matter what might be what … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
stone

no matter how life-like
the stone feels
how warm how heavy
with blood how much
like a wolf-cub
a man-cub no matter
its shape
how it writhes
against you
how you hold it
no matter what might
be what potential you find
in its cold eyes no matter
how much you’ve come to love
it is still a stone you carry
it will always be a stone

item.title: 29 – hit and run report
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: hit and run report And the victim, Max Martin, is described as remaining That’s it. The page ends but does Max Martin, the victim? He remains I’m told, but nothing more. Where? In what state? The rest is left vague. … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
hit and run report

And the victim,
Max Martin,
is described as remaining

That’s it. The page ends
but does Max Martin,
the victim? He remains

I’m told, but nothing more.
Where? In what state?
The rest is left vague.

I suppose I could simply turn
the page and learn
the plain truth

about recovery time,
litigation, the injurious
particulars,

and let
that be that,
but some hand

I can’t fully grasp
stays me,
stirs me

to hazard wild
guesses about
the unknown

victim,
Max Martin,
and the state of

his remaining.
Bound, now, somehow
to my own.

//ht: The Bee newspaper//

item.title: 28 – Limelight
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Limelight Cut out early. Duck inside. Hide away. Sit the afternoon. Drink cold Pabst for two bucks a pint. Listen to Sonny and Otis and Miles. Listen to blues on a real jukebox the bartender feeds with till quarters. Listen … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Limelight

Cut out early. Duck inside. Hide away.
Sit the afternoon. Drink cold Pabst
for two bucks a pint. Listen to Sonny
and Otis and Miles. Listen to blues
on a real jukebox the bartender feeds
with till quarters. Listen to the idle chatter.
Listen to bullshit stories with a nugget of truth.
Listen to the 9 Ball break. Listen and write
it all down. Write down the absent, accidental
poems. The ones at the bottom of pint glasses,
bubbling up in the fry-grease, read in the wet ring
left on the bar. Tom Waits calls them out,
lone-wolf growling poems into the room
to bark and shimmer. To strip down and shout,
writhe around a little. Feel them. Feel it:
this is the place you become famous.

//Flavor note: written on a bar napkin. Of course.//

item.title: 27 – Counter Work
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Counter Work Fickle latch. Broken bell. Half-assed toaster. Microwave that works only sort-of sometimes. Regulars I’ve known by ounce and extra hot, decaf, how many shots? Some by name. Which tips well while scowling, which never will, then once in … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Counter Work

Fickle latch. Broken bell.
Half-assed toaster. Microwave
that works only sort-of sometimes.
Regulars I’ve known by ounce
and extra hot, decaf, how many shots?
Some by name. Which tips well
while scowling, which never will,
then once in a blue moon, do.
Idiosyncrasies I’ll miss
when I’m done holding down
this particular patch of concrete,
these reinforced EZ-Knees mats,
this small corner of the world
at Holgate and 28th. Sunrise
through the bent laurel hedge.
Tide of TriMet’s ebb and flow.
The million and one leaves left
swirling in the wind.

item.title: 26 – Parlay
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Parlay Mission: bring down the castle smash its right-sided blocks in a heap. Light it on fire. Bask in the glow of the built environment man-made shelter too-well kept. Run up a new flag, many colored. Dream never-seen insignia; of … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Parlay

Mission: bring down the castle
smash its right-sided blocks
in a heap.
Light it on fire.

Bask in the glow
of the built environment
man-made shelter
too-well kept.

Run up a new flag, many colored.
Dream never-seen insignia;
of no known people or country.
We are the new people.

Discover in the twist of hair,
elbows certain crook
what forms
have always been.

Find depths’ edge. Push beyond.
Make new maps; commit them
to memory.
Draw them again.

Burn what must be burned.
Turn every stone. Spare nothing.
Level and leave them
warm in the embers.
